member.name: T:StatMonitor.SysInfo.CpuUsage
member.summary: Defines an abstract base class for implementations of CPU usage counters.

member.name: M:StatMonitor.SysInfo.CpuUsage.Create
member.summary: Creates and returns a CpuUsage instance that can be used to query the CPU time on this operating system.
member.returns: An instance of the CpuUsage class.
member.exception: This platform is not supported -or- initialization of the CPUUsage object failed.

member.name: M:StatMonitor.SysInfo.CpuUsage.Query
member.summary: Determines the current average CPU load.
member.returns: An integer that holds the CPU load percentage.
member.exception: One of the system calls fails. The CPU time can not be obtained.

member.name: F:StatMonitor.SysInfo.CpuUsage.m_CpuUsage
member.summary: Holds an instance of the CPUUsage class.

member.name: T:StatMonitor.SysInfo.CpuUsageNt
member.summary: Inherits the CPUUsage class and implements the Query method for Windows NT systems.

remarks.p: This class works on Windows NT4, Windows 2000, Windows XP, Windows .NET Server and higher.
You should not use this class directly in your code. Use the CPUUsage.Create() method to instantiate a CPUUsage object.

member.name: M:StatMonitor.SysInfo.CpuUsageNt.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new CpuUsageNt instance.
member.exception: One of the system calls fails.

member.name: M:StatMonitor.SysInfo.CpuUsageNt.Query
member.summary: Determines the current average CPU load.
member.returns: An integer that holds the CPU load percentage.
member.exception: One of the system calls fails. The CPU time can not be obtained.

member.name: M:StatMonitor.SysInfo.CpuUsageNt.NtQuerySystemInformation(System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: NtQuerySystemInformation is an internal Windows function that retrieves various kinds of system information.
member.param: One of the values enumerated in SYSTEM_INFORMATION_CLASS, indicating the kind of system information to be retrieved.
Points to a buffer where the requested information is to be returned. The size and structure of this information varies depending on the value of the SystemInformationClass parameter.
Length of the buffer pointed to by the SystemInformation parameter.
Optional pointer to a location where the function writes the actual size of the information requested.
member.returns: Returns a success NTSTATUS if successful, and an NTSTATUS error code otherwise.

member.name: F:StatMonitor.SysInfo.CpuUsageNt.SYSTEM_BASICINFORMATION
member.summary: Returns the number of processors in the system in a SYSTEM_BASIC_INFORMATION structure.

member.name: F:StatMonitor.SysInfo.CpuUsageNt.SYSTEM_PERFORMANCEINFORMATION
member.summary: Returns an opaque SYSTEM_PERFORMANCE_INFORMATION structure.

member.name: F:StatMonitor.SysInfo.CpuUsageNt.SYSTEM_TIMEINFORMATION
member.summary: Returns an opaque SYSTEM_TIMEOFDAY_INFORMATION structure.

member.name: F:StatMonitor.SysInfo.CpuUsageNt.NO_ERROR
member.summary: The value returned by NtQuerySystemInformation is no error occurred.

member.name: F:StatMonitor.SysInfo.CpuUsageNt.oldIdleTime
member.summary: Holds the old idle time.

member.name: F:StatMonitor.SysInfo.CpuUsageNt.oldSystemTime
member.summary: Holds the old system time.

member.name: F:StatMonitor.SysInfo.CpuUsageNt.processorCount
member.summary: Holds the number of processors in the system.

member.summary: Returns information for the current user. If you wish to run the application with the current Windows user credentials, call My.User.InitializeWithWindowsUser().

member.summary: Returns the application log. The listeners can be configured by the application's configuration file.
